message:
سؤال للناس الي فاهمين git core.
دلوقتي كنت برفع فولدر حجمه 200 ميجا. 
كنت شغال عالshell وعملت push. لقيت الshell فتح 4 threads بعد ما جمع عدد الfiles الي هتترفع.
تقسيمت الthreads ازاي وبانهي قانون حسبو عدد الthreads ؟؟

data.message: على حسب ال thread المتوافرة عندك على الجهاز و هل النسخه 32/64
Pushing large files to git repositories is bad, git wasn't designed for file hosting.
Usually that's the number of threads is a simple function of the number of CPU cores you have

It's simply a configuration option in git. 
You can simply change that with

git config --global pack.threads "2"
or by editing the configuration file ".gitconfig"

Acoording to the implementation here
https://github.com/git/git/blob/master/builtin/index-pack.c

If the thread number is not specified, the default is min(n_CPUs,  3)
As they claim that:
"An experiment showed that more threads does not mean faster"  according to the  source code of git
